In Chungking also: It is well now.
I stayed at the Airport until
about 5 o'clock and then*
went up to
the Star Ferry, Kowloon, intending to cross over to Hong-
kong to
see Madame Kung. When I arrived at the ferry, I discov-a
could go over to. Hongkong from
Kowloon without a police
permit, which I did not have.: So I then returned to the Airport.
At 7
o'clock our first plane,
off for Namyung, loaded

At 9:30 I got Madame Kung over the telephone in Hongkong.
I. told her I had a message from Dr. Kung.: I should state here that
this was the second time.
that day. that I had talked with her over
the phone:
I told Madame Kung that we had our planes in operation
and that we thought we would be able to
get her and her family out.
She again raised the question as to how dangerous this would be.
I told her
was undoubtedly some danger connected with it but
I had no way
of
telling whether
